review_title: Math tutor at Oxnard college library
pros: Flexible hours. Great student job. Great working environment. Staff are friendly.
Beautiful campus and they do a lot for the students

job_title: Part Time College Professor in Oxnard, CA
pros: Of the 3 campuses in the VCCCD, it is the best one to work as either Faculty or Classified Staff. Relationships between Faculty members and Classified are good and cooperative, as well as those between departments. For the most part the administrators are supportive.
cons:
Diversity should mean a good mix of race, ethnic, disabled, etc of Faculty & staff not primarily Hispanic. Equity Parity between Part-Time Faculty and Full Time Faculty pay and numbers is below the State Requirement (This is a VCCCD standard not individual campus policy per se)
Night classes have no support, no food sources for those students who come straight to class from work and are hungry, majority of restrooms are closed forcing faculty and students to go into other buildings to find an open one, Campus security is not readily available as they often to not answer their phones ( why are they forwarded to their cell phones if they are walking or driving around the campus?), no tech help if the "smart room" system has issues.

pros: Flexible hours, great atmosphere and colleagues
cons: Overtime isn't an option and management is hard to contact.

pros: there are 3 campuses in the Venture Community College District.  Oxnard College has the best overall campus climate, with positive work environment in regards to collaboration between faculty and staff, and SOME managers.  The students are great.  The general attitude of faculty and staff towards the students is caring and nurturing.  I have had many students show their appreciation to me with cards, and various gifts.
cons: The VCCCD board of trustees have a long history of NOT appreciating faculty and in particular part time faculty.  The practice is to NOT hire present PT faculty for full time positions, but rather those who come from outside the district.  The board at present has proposed that faculty should only receive a 1 % pay increase if they process a minimum of 35 students out of the classroom.  Simply put.  Turn the college into a factory, where student learning is not the mission or goal, only numbers matter.  The board is both brainless and heartless, and apparently does not get that without classroom teachers.. THERE IS NO COLLEGE!

pros: Some excellent faculty and program staff.
cons:
Want to work for a good organization? Do NOT come here. 

Everyone is sick and/or sad. Serious institutional deficiencies. Shoddy administration. They’ve had something like 12 presidents over the last 10 years and four VPs of Enrollment Management over the last year and half. … Arrogant, incompetent, insecure. Nothing of substance gets done outside of the classroom. The results — low student success rates, low enrollment numbers, high employee turnover, an internal communications disorder, and lots of people on medical (stress) leave. There are 100+ community colleges in California. Don’t waste your time on this one. It’s a career ZERO, especially if Cynthia Azari is still president. 

Want to know more about the culture? Here’s an anecdote: imagine working for an institution for more than 20 years and then having the new president gleefully fire you without warning. Then imagine dying three weeks later from a surprise cancer and having your death unmentioned by leadership. Heartless. 

I feel for anyone who every joined this organization thinking it was mission-driven. 

Save your spirit, save your career. Look elsewhere.

pros: Solid fiscal and instructional leadership. Clear vision from leadership on their long term goals for the institution. New leadership at in the Chancellor's Office has created a hopeful atmosphere that positive changes are in the offing.
cons: State of California's fiscal mess has created substantial losses for the institution. Add to this the fact that it is the smallest of a three college district. Resources are available if the right case is made but overall they're under funded.

pros:
-Flexible hours
-Great work environment
-Wonderful people
-Never felt over worked
cons:
-Limited hours available 
-Must be a full time student at Oxnard College and passed English 101

job_title: Oxnard College Bookstore Associate in Oxnard, CA
pros: Great managers and co-workers. Always willing to help if you have questions.
Everyone is super friendly and want to help students succeed in college.
cons: Being in the office all day.

pros: Great students, interesting classes, and really liked the feedback from the students.
cons: Dean was horrible about communication with me, and told me at the last minute that it was my last day. Students were upset!!
